result.execSummary:
The defendant Jemal J. Tanner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
ANY UNPIAD COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE STILL TO BE PAID
Conditions the same as for probation.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be appiled.    
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with known felons, Canyon M or Travis V or address of gas station of 1401 - 75th St., unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Celebre. Clerk/H. Barnett. Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 8 years WSP:  4 years initial confinement w/credit for 84 days served; 4 years extended supervision; deft placed on probation for 5 years w/conditions concurrent to 10CF1362; 1 year conditional jail w/Huber privileges; deft to report to jail on 3/24/18 at 6pm; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster. No contact with known felons, Canyon M., Travis V., address of gas station at 1401 75th St, Kenosha.
NOH sent to deft  Returned from the United Postal Service.  Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
Sentencing hearing on March 16, 2018 at 08:45 am.
With Atty Celebre and by approval of Judge Wagner the SEH of 2/23/18 at 11am is rescheduled, as the deft is home sick; reset to 3/16/18 at 8:45am.
NOH sent to deft  Returned from the United Postal Service.  Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
Sentencing hearing on February 23, 2018 at 11:00 am.

NOH sent to deft  Returned from the United Postal Service.  Return to sender.  Not deliverable as addressed.  Unable to forward.
Sentencing hearing on February 1, 2018 at 09:00 am.

With Atty Celebre the SEH of 1/8/18 at 2pm is rescheduled; as per DOC Agt Christina Nolan the deft missed his interview appointment; per Judge Wagner ok to reschedule to give her more time to meet with him and prepare the PSI; reset to 2/1/18 at 9:00am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jemal J. Tanner appeared with Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.   Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  case heard with co-def 16CF9.      ST called witness KPD Det. Mark Poffenberger ; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Caspari and Atty Rufo. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Both DE's have filed substitution of Br 3; tab pulled for Br 6. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
